snippet: More than 180 mayors, governors and other leaders have joined the Obama administration’s effort to end homelessness among military veterans by the end of 2015, Ms. Obama said Thursday.
abstract: First Lady Michelle Obama details progress of administration's effort to end homelessness among military veterans by end of 2015, saying Phoenix and Salt Lake City have already eliminated chronic homelessness among their veterans, and New Orleans is expected to do the same within six months; more than 180 mayors, governors and other leaders have joined effort.
lead_paragraph: More than 180 mayors, governors and other leaders have joined the Obama administration’s effort to end homelessness among military veterans by the end of 2015, Ms. Obama said Thursday.

headline.main: Mrs. Obama Details Progress in Effort to End Homelessness Among Veterans
headline.print_headline: Michelle Obama Details Progress in Aim to End Homelessness Among Veterans
